meanings.definition: Thiabendazoles: a group of chemical compounds used as anthelmintic agents to treat parasitic worm infections.
meanings.sent1: The veterinarian prescribed thiabendazoles to help the dog get rid of worms.
meanings.sent2: Farmers use thiabendazoles to protect their livestock from parasitic infections.
meanings.sent3: The worms were so scared of the thiabendazoles that they decided to move out of the cow!
meanings.sent4: Thiabendazoles acted like knights, fighting off the invading worms in the animal's body.
meanings.sent5: The thiabendazoles worked tirelessly, like tiny soldiers, battling the worms to keep the animals healthy.
